intro: Hieracium pazense, commonly known as the Pazent's hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows and grasslands, preferring well-drained soils. It produces yellow flowers with a central disk surrounded by ray florets, and its leaves are usually hairy and lance-shaped. Hieracium pazense is often found in open habitats and can be an indicator of disturbed or nutrient-rich environments.
